20110105162452.000|20110105162454.000|TR0|WHITFIELD:  One and a half million 
20110105162454.000|20110105162457.000|TR0|Americans filed bankruptcy in 2010. The 
20110105162457.000|20110105162500.000|TR0|CNN Money team's Stephanie Elam is here 
20110105162500.000|20110105162503.000|TR0|with today's "Top Tips."
20110105162503.000|20110105162505.000|TR0|
20110105162505.000|20110105162508.000|TR0|So, Stephanie, there are a few things to 
20110105162508.000|20110105162511.000|TR0|think about before filing bankruptcy.
20110105162511.000|20110105162514.000|TR0|
20110105162514.000|20110105162517.000|TR0|STEPHANIE ELAM, CNN BUSINESS 
20110105162517.000|20110105162519.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  Yes, that's for sure. You 
20110105162519.000|20110105162522.000|TR0|really have to weigh the pros and cons 
20110105162522.000|20110105162525.000|TR0|here when you take a look at this story, 
20110105162525.000|20110105162528.000|TR0|Fred.  And bankruptcies, they were up nine 
20110105162528.000|20110105162530.000|TR0|percent in 2010, and have increased every 
20110105162530.000|20110105162533.000|TR0|year since 2005.  That's according to the 
20110105162533.000|20110105162536.000|TR0|American Bankruptcy Institute and the 
20110105162536.000|20110105162539.000|TR0|National Bankruptcy Research Center.
20110105162539.000|20110105162541.000|TR0|
20110105162541.000|20110105162544.000|TR0|Now, while it can be a way to get out from 
20110105162544.000|20110105162547.000|TR0|a huge mountain of debt, no doubt, it does 
20110105162547.000|20110105162550.000|TR0|come at a cost.  And that's what you need 
20110105162550.000|20110105162553.000|TR0|to remember.
20110105162553.000|20110105162555.000|TR0|
20110105162555.000|20110105162558.000|TR0|First, bankruptcy stays on your credit 
20110105162558.000|20110105162601.000|TR0|report for 10 years and will affect your 
20110105162601.000|20110105162604.000|TR0|ability to get any loans, credit cards, 
20110105162604.000|20110105162606.000|TR0|even a job.  And when it comes to your 
20110105162606.000|20110105162609.000|TR0|credit score, filing for bankruptcy will 
20110105162609.000|20110105162612.000|TR0|knock off about 300 points from your 
20110105162612.000|20110105162615.000|TR0|credit score.
20110105162615.000|20110105162617.000|TR0|
20110105162617.000|20110105162620.000|TR0|So, take this into account.  John 
20110105162620.000|20110105162623.000|TR0|Ulzheimer with smartcredit.com says the 
20110105162623.000|20110105162626.000|TR0|elite score is 750.  And if you look at 
20110105162626.000|20110105162629.000|TR0|this chart that we got from John, you can 
20110105162629.000|20110105162631.000|TR0|see that the range of the credit score 
20110105162631.000|20110105162634.000|TR0|scale -- well, if you're looking at one, 
20110105162634.000|20110105162637.000|TR0|you can see that -- there we go -- you can 
20110105162637.000|20110105162640.000|TR0|see that it ranges down around to poor 
20110105162640.000|20110105162642.000|TR0|credit, 600 to 649.
20110105162642.000|20110105162645.000|TR0|
20110105162645.000|20110105162648.000|TR0|So, if you look at where your credit 
20110105162648.000|20110105162651.000|TR0|probably is within there, you probably 
20110105162651.000|20110105162654.000|TR0|already missed some payments, think about 
20110105162654.000|20110105162656.000|TR0|what it would be like after you go for 
20110105162656.000|20110105162659.000|TR0|bankruptcy.
20110105162659.000|20110105162702.000|TR0|
20110105162702.000|20110105162705.000|TR0|WHITFIELD:  Oh, boy.  But then there are 
20110105162705.000|20110105162707.000|TR0|cases in which a bankruptcy is good.  I 
20110105162707.000|20110105162710.000|TR0|mean, you really have no other better

20110105162713.000|20110105162716.000|TR0|
20110105162716.000|20110105162718.000|TR0|ELAM:  Right.  Well, take a look at it 
20110105162718.000|20110105162721.000|TR0|this way.  If you've had your wages 
20110105162721.000|20110105162724.000|TR0|garnished, you can't see paying off your 
20110105162724.000|20110105162727.000|TR0|debts in three to five years, or maybe if

20110105162741.000|20110105162743.000|TR0|consumer.adi.org.
20110105162743.000|20110105162746.000|TR0|
20110105162746.000|20110105162749.000|TR0|Now, as for the major difference between 
20110105162749.000|20110105162752.000|TR0|Chapter 7 and Chapter 13, you may hear 
20110105162752.000|20110105162754.000|TR0|about those.  It's all about how much you 
20110105162754.000|20110105162757.000|TR0|pay.
20110105162757.000|20110105162800.000|TR0|
20110105162800.000|20110105162803.000|TR0|Chapter 7 is a two-to-three-month process 
20110105162803.000|20110105162806.000|TR0|where your property is sold to pay your 
20110105162806.000|20110105162808.000|TR0|debts, like credit cards or medical bills. 
20110105162808.000|20110105162811.000|TR0| Chapter 13 is more of a reorganization of 
20110105162811.000|20110105162814.000|TR0|your debt.  So it takes about three to 
20110105162814.000|20110105162817.000|TR0|five years, and you pay a portion of your 
20110105162817.000|20110105162819.000|TR0|debt under a court-ordered plan, and this 
20110105162819.000|20110105162822.000|TR0|allows you to stay in your home.
20110105162822.000|20110105162825.000|TR0|
20110105162825.000|20110105162828.000|TR0|But, Fred, this is one thing I've got to 
20110105162828.000|20110105162830.000|TR0|remind people.  It really doesn't matter 
20110105162830.000|20110105162833.000|TR0|which type you file.  Neither is going to 
20110105162833.000|20110105162836.000|TR0|wipe away student loans, it's not going to 
20110105162836.000|20110105162839.000|TR0|get rid of child support, or your tax 
20110105162839.000|20110105162842.000|TR0|debts.  So what you want to do here is

20110105162844.000|20110105162847.000|TR0|attorney in your area.  You can do that by
